intro: Acioa parvifolia, commonly known as the small-leaved acioa, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant features small, ovate leaves with a leathery texture and produces clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. Acioa parvifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its compact growth habit and attractive foliage. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires partial to full sunlight.
